description.narrative: The project is aimed at contributing to addressing the youth unemployment challenge that Uganda faces through providing young graduates, with access to work spaces to gain employability skills.

participating-org.narrative: UGA Min of Water and Env

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Output 1. By 2019, targeted MDAs, private sector & CSOs with adequate technical & functional capacity to develop and review employment policy and regulatory frameworks to ensure increased access to labour markets and ensure employment decency and safety, equity for women, youth & other vulnerable groups 1.1. Number of sector policies and plans mainstreaming employment creation for women, youth and other vulnerable groups 1.2. Number of existing policies and regulations that are reviewed to better mainstream employment of young graduates 1.3. Existence of a legal framework for establishment of the Uganda Graduate Volunteer Scheme as a public institution/programme
Output 2. By 2019, targeted MDAs with adequate technical and functional capacity to work with Private sector, including women & youth-led MSMEs, in operationalizing the Employment Policy and enforcement of the related regulations 2.1. Existence of Uganda Graduate Volunteer Scheme expected as a public institution/programme 2.2. “# of potential candidates registered in a web based database 2.3. Number of graduates who have received volunteer placement as a labour intermediation mechanism, by sex and disability status 2.4. Percentage of deployed graduate volunteers that are retained by host organizations or facilitated to start innovative businesses as a pathway to long term employment, by sex and disability status 2.6. Number of project targeted graduates engaged in innovative entrepreneurship initiatives countrywide, by sex and disability status

comment.narrative:
Output 1. By 2019, targeted MDAs, private sector & CSOs with adequate technical & functional capacity to develop and review employment policy and regulatory frameworks to ensure increased access to labour markets and ensure employment decency and safety, equity for women, youth & other vulnerable groups 1.1. Number of sector policies and plans mainstreaming employment creation for women, youth and other vulnerable groups (baseline: 1) 1.2. Number of existing policies and regulations that are reviewed to better mainstream employment of young graduates (Baseline: 0) 1.3. Existence of a legal framework for establishment of the Uganda Graduate Volunteer Scheme as a public institution/programme (Baseline: No)
Output 2. By 2019, targeted MDAs with adequate technical and functional capacity to work with Private sector, including women & youth-led MSMEs, in operationalizing the Employment Policy and enforcement of the related regulations 2.1. Existence of Uganda Graduate Volunteer Scheme expected as a public institution/programme (Baseline: No) 2.2. “# of potential candidates registered in a web based database (Baseline: No) 2.3. Number of graduates who have received volunteer placement as a labour intermediation mechanism, by sex and disability status (Baseline: 0) 2.4. Percentage of deployed graduate volunteers that are retained by host organizations or facilitated to start innovative businesses as a pathway to long term employment, by sex and disability status (Baseline: 0) 2.6. Number of project targeted graduates engaged in innovative entrepreneurship initiatives countrywide, by sex and disability status (Baseline: 0)

Output 1. By 2019, targeted MDAs, private sector & CSOs with adequate technical & functional capacity to develop and review employment policy and regulatory frameworks to ensure increased access to labour markets and ensure employment decency and safety, equity for women, youth & other vulnerable groups 1.1. No target 1.2. No target 1.3. No target
Output 2. By 2019, targeted MDAs with adequate technical and functional capacity to work with Private sector, including women & youth-led MSMEs, in operationalizing the Employment Policy and enforcement of the related regulations 2.1. Existence of Uganda Graduate Volunteer Scheme expected as a public institution/programme 2.2. # of potential candidates registered in a web based database 2.3. 100 (M=50;F=50) graduates who have received volunteer placement as a labour intermediation mechanism, by sex and disability status 2.4. 30% of deployed graduate volunteers that are retained by host organizations or facilitated to start innovative businesses as a pathway to long term employment, by sex and disability status 2.6. 5 project targeted graduates engaged in innovative entrepreneurship initiatives countrywide, by sex and disability status

Output 1. By 2019, targeted MDAs, private sector & CSOs with adequate technical & functional capacity to develop and review employment policy and regulatory frameworks to ensure increased access to labour markets and ensure employment decency and safety, equity for women, youth & other vulnerable groups 1.1. No intervention undertaken 1.2. No intervention undertaken 1.3. No intervention undertaken
Output 2. By 2019, targeted MDAs with adequate technical and functional capacity to work with Private sector, including women & youth-led MSMEs, in operationalizing the Employment Policy and enforcement of the related regulations 2.1. A Uganda Graduate Volunteer Scheme is in existence and expected to continue as a public institution/programme 2.2. 10,000 potential candidates registered in the web based database 2.3. 109 (M=46; F=61) graduates have received volunteer placement as a labour intermediation mechanism, by sex and disability status 2.4. 38% (M=36; F=40) of deployed graduate volunteers that are retained by host organizations or facilitated to start innovative businesses as a pathway to long term employment, by sex and disability status 2.6. 9 project targeted graduates engaged in innovative entrepreneurship initiatives countrywide, by sex and disability status

Output 1. Targeted MDAs, private sector & CSOs with adequate technical & functional capacity to develop and review employment policy and regulatory frameworks to ensure increased access to labour markets and ensure employment decency and safety, equity for women, youth & other vulnerable groups
1.1. 1 sector policy and plan has mainstreamed employment creation for women, youth and other vulnerable groups
1.2. 1 existing policy and regulation reviewed to better mainstream employment of young graduates
1.3. Existence of a legal framework for establishment of the Uganda Graduate Volunteer Scheme as a public institution/programme
Output 2. By 2019, targeted MDAs with adequate technical and functional capacity to work with Private sector, including women & youth-led MSMEs, in operationalizing the Employment Policy and enforcement of the related regulations
2.1. Existence of Uganda Graduate Volunteer Scheme expected as a public institution/programme
2.2. 5000 (2,500F: 2,500M) potential candidates (young graduates) registered in a web based database (Uganda Graduate Volunteer Online System
2.3. 200 (100F: 100M) young graduates who have received volunteer placement as a labour intermediation mechanism
2.4. 40% of deployed graduate volunteers are retained by host organizations or facilitated to start innovative businesses as a pathway to long term employment
2.6. 1,000 projects targeting graduates engaged in innovative entrepreneurship initiatives countrywide

Output 1. Targeted MDAs, private sector & CSOs with adequate technical & functional capacity to develop and review employment policy and regulatory frameworks to ensure increased access to labour markets and ensure employment decency and safety, equity for women, youth & other vulnerable groups
1.1. 1 sector policy and plan has mainstreamed employment creation for women, youth and other vulnerable groups
1.2. 1 existing policy and regulation reviewed to better mainstream employment of young graduates
1.3. Existence of a legal framework for establishment of the Uganda Graduate Volunteer Scheme as a public institution/programme
Output 2. By 2019, targeted MDAs with adequate technical and functional capacity to work with Private sector, including women & youth-led MSMEs, in operationalizing the Employment Policy and enforcement of the related regulations
2.1. Existence of Uganda Graduate Volunteer Scheme expected as a public institution/programme
2.2. 5000 (2,500F: 2,500M) potential candidates (young graduates) registered in a web based database (Uganda Graduate Volunteer Online System
2.3. 209 (109F: 100M) young graduates who have received volunteer placement as a labour intermediation mechanism
2.4. 40% of deployed graduate volunteers are retained by host organizations or facilitated to start innovative businesses as a pathway to long term employment
2.6. 1,000 projects targeting graduates engaged in innovative entrepreneurship initiatives countrywide
